Reviews.Title: “Good spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wayne M
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family (wife and 2 children) overnight. Staff (Bob and Anne) were great and were very accommodating. The two bedroom apartment was very good, the position of the apartments is superb...around the corner from Chinatown, a 5 min walk to the Darling Harbour precinct, 120m walk to the nearest Monorail station and supermarket, 100m to the free city loop bus, cinemas and eateries galore right on your doorstep. I will be making The Waldorf my preferred place to stay when I'm staying overnight in Sydney. Compared to where I've stayed before, I think the price is very reasonable for something that is this convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Poor personal service”
Reviews.Author: Gary T
Reviews.Content: I rang and told booking that i wanted to be in the room at 1Pm upon arriving at 11.30am office unattended so rang at 11.45am and told staff member we were attending my brother in laws funeral and neeeded to get changed by 1pm told me cleaners had not got to our room and we couldnt have keys to the room therefore we had to go to public toilets to get changed at 1.20pm .How disgusting is that???

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OzzieinDC
Reviews.Content: This is very good value for money. My partner and I stayed here for three nights with my parents. It was ideal for a family vacation. The apartments are a little tired and could do with updating, but they are spacious and offer a large living area with a balcony as well as a kitchen, which enabled us to save on breakfasts and other meals if we wanted to. There is a Coles supermarket just across the road to purchase bread, cereal, milk etc. and the Waldorf provide tea and coffee in the kitchen. We arrived well before our check in time as we had travelled that day from the US and the staff worked very quickly to enable us to check in to our apartment early. We found the staff at all times to be very helpful and accommodating. We stayed on a higher floor and there was very little noise from the street below. The apartments are a very short walk from Darling Habour, China Town and the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: Roselyn K
Reviews.Content: Arriving after dark in Liverpool Street, it took us an hour and a half to find the hotel. The entrance was poorly lit. Many times during our 5-day stay, the automatic front door and the car park gates failed to open when we used our swipe card. Rooms were adequate and reasonably priced for the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sstuff3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days in January 2011 for business. The room was a one-bedroom suite with a kitchen and balcony overlooking Liverpool Street. Although the room could use some updating, the stay was pleasant and the staff very willing to help anyway they could. Will definitely stay here on my future trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well set up”
Reviews.Author: NZyoungfamily
Reviews.Content: Apartment was ideal for our young family, we used the apartment after a long trip and was ideal place to crash. Centrally located easy walk to middle of town about a kilometre. Found staff helpful and pleasant. Easy to order in takeaway food and can buy food about 400 metres away, nice cafe around corner, would recommend for longer stays as well.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lekejo
Reviews.Content: What a gem. We came to Sydney on a family holliday and couldn't believe our luck when we walked into our apartment. The apartment is large and very clean and it has everything that we need. The city views are great and having the balconies is a bonus. An extra bonus that we found is the staff at the front desk. It is worth having a chat with them about what you are doing because bthey have some great ideas and tips. We will be staying here again when we are next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly frayed around the edges, but good value”
Reviews.Author: Majik_One
Reviews.Content: Three adults and one four year old for seven nights. Great location and friendly staff. Beds slightly hard but overall excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Farther and son”
Reviews.Author: VIP1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay!!!we had first booked for waldorf chippendale (south sydney) but they had not found our booking and had no rooms left but no problems they booked us in at waldorf liverpool st rite in the heart of the cbd and no onl did we much prefer it by far not just because of the location but also we has booked and studio and they upgraded us to a one bedroom apartment for no extra cost which was fantastic it even has cable tv the only problem was the carpet was Little bit old but no problem at all.I has a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Not as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: livertransplant
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this property & someone obviously had a bad experience & theres nothing worse, we on the other hand after speaking with the managers who were very open about the apartments condition & age & location were not dissapointed , we found the staff to be very accommodating & helpful , sure the rooms are old & need refurbishing but we knew that before arriving, my advise ask about the apartments when booking.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump. Management should be prosecuted.”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe that a dump like this existed in the heart of Sydney. Our room: - cigarette burns on the carpet and sofa - graffiti carved into the dining table - lumpy mattresses on beds that moved across the room whenever you rolled over - dirty curtains on rails that had been broken and hence falling down - sliding door to balcony would not lock, we ended up using a wire coat-hanger to secure the room whilst we were out at meetings - wardrobes smelt of armpits And when we complained to management, all they had to say was, "yeah, quite a few people have complained about that room"!!!! The above list is 100% true, no exaggeration. And silly us, we stayed the night! (We'd pre-paid and hence had little to no chance of getting a refund, plus we ended up with a great story). I don't usually bag other people or establishments, but have absolutely no hesitation in telling *everybody* that this place is a total dump.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk”
Reviews.Author: Traveller99955
Reviews.Content: Looked great on website. Good price for location & 4 adult accom & carspace. Did not expect 5 star accomm at price, but did not meet basic level of cleanliness. Room dirty, walls, doors covered in dirty marks. Appears quick, very basic clean after each guests stay, no other clean/maintenance. May suit some, but not me.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Wandrin'Star
Reviews.Content: Good location in Liverpool Street, close to monorail station - shame about the state of the apartments. We were in a two bedroom apartment at a very reasonable rate for the centre of the city. The apartment was spacious, but, although it had been cleaned, dull and grubby-looking. The carpets were heavily stained although obviously vacuumed, the net curtains were black with dirt (can't tell about the heavy curtains as they were dark green anyway), the bathrooms a bit mouldy in places, several lights did not work, one of the wardrobes smelled musty and could not be used and had to be kept closed, the washing machine missing was missing a couple of knobs (therefore it was not possible to use it) and the air conditioning/heating did not work on the winter setting and constantly blew cold air. We had to turn it off altogether as the apartment was very chilly - it was very cool in Sydney anyway. This is the first accommodation where we have actually had to use the extra blankets. No advance warning was given that the pool area was closed for maintenance. Also, we had to remove our car from the hotel car park for most of one day whilst the car park was pressure-cleaned. One reason we chose this hotel was for the parking as we did not intend to drive around Sydney for the two days we were there and we ended up having to use public parking which cost us the best part of AUD50 for a few hours and interrupted our plans for our very short visit to the city. We only found out about the pool closing and the car park problem by way of signs in the lift. The staff gave us no indication of this when we checked in considering they must have known about the arrangements for the pool and car park. Liverpool Street and the surrounding area is also very grubby although on the edge of Chinatown which is much vaunted as a tourist attraction. The hotel website looks impressive, but, this was one of the most disappointing bookings we have ever made anywhere in the world. As we were only there for two days we did not wish to take up any more of our time advising reception of our concerns and these problems should be obvious to the management anyway. Room 104 in case the hotel is interested.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Waldorf Apartment Hotel at Liverpool Street, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: last99
Reviews.Content: My advise is, look for other great deal before you even consider to stay in this apartment hotel. I don't look for good view, good bed or anything. Just clean place. Paid quite high price for what so called "hotel", AUD 155 per night. Anyway, the apartment was dirty. Here are what I am really disappoint at. 1. Baby COCKROACH everywhere! worst hotel! in bathroom and even in the kitchen. I wouldn't even dare to step my foot without slipper anywhere in that apartment. I have pictures of them if you are interested. 2. Carpet is not vacuum. 3. Sofa bed sheet has shoe print Paid 3 night through online. Told receptionist about the situation and they just give us "Mortien"! Staff is not friendly and what funny is, they told us to grab taxi when we ask how to go to "Star City" which is a place in walking distance. Who doesn't know how to get taxi?

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: aussie_rose64
Reviews.Content: four of my family stayed here for a week and thought it was good value. my husband and i and two teens shared a one bedroom apartment, we had a queen bed and a fold out sofa. there were a couple of problems but nothing that i could say spoilt our holiday. the sink leaked a bit and the dryer door wouldn't close properly but these weren't a huge problem and easily fixed. we didn't spend that much time in the room and when we did it was quit comfortable. we used the pool and spa on the roof and that was great after a day of sight seeing. the monorail comes right past the front of the building and the station is just up the road. noise was loud sometimes coming from the street but didn't disturb us that much. heaps of places to eat close by and coles just down the road for groceries. all that said i would recommend these apartments for people looking for somewhere cheap to stay but still want comfort. they are in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Grubby Waldorf Apartments, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Diccen
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Apartments in Sydney on Liverpool have a great location, close to Darling Harbour. However, the apartments are tired and grubby. The Carpet in the apartment we are staying in is covered in black grubby marks and is filthy. When we asked about this at reception, we were told that, "they are all pretty much like that. On the plus side, the apartments are clean, and the aircon is efficient and quiet. Also the bedrooms are reasonably quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling!!”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireLizzy
Reviews.Content: we browsed the Waldorf website, and after seeing pictures of luxurious rooms, and the beautiful apartments, booked direct by email. We live in the UK, and after arriving tired and weary expected to relax in our Waldorf apartment. On opening the door we had an unpleasent shock!...these apartments are truly truly appalling. Holes in the furnishings and carpets, as well as badly stained carpets and furnishings. Floor tiles missing and loose, burnt worksrfaces in the kitchen. i walked a few feet on the carpet and the soles of my feet were filthy with dirt. Needless to say we complained, the receptionist wasn't surprised we were unhappy, he showed us another apartment, but that was equalling disgusting...they look like squats! We quickly found a superb alternative apartment in the Meriton Serviced Apartments opposite in Kent Street.....they frequently have people moving across the road when travellers arrive at the Waldorf and see the state of the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly: Great location but apartments are tired”
Reviews.Author: Kairangagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin one-room apartment at the Waldorf Apartments in Liverpool St for 6 nights in October 2006. The good: Its a great location - a few minutes walk from the CBD, Darling Harbour and Chinatown. We were able to get free carparking in the building at the last minute without any problems. The rooms were serviced promptly every day. We had booked a roll away bed and this was delivered as ordered. The bad: There is poor sound insulation and Liverpool St is very noisy at night especially Thursday - Saturday. Be prepared to be kept awake! The monorail runs across the front of the building and this runs late into the night adding to the noise. The ugly: The apartments are very tired and in need of a full refurbishment. Carpets are marked and some furniture needs repairing.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and even better”
Reviews.Author: Tonyb15
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel from a stay 2 years ago. I have just returned from a repeat stay this time in a one bedroom apartment. The apartment was clean, tidy and had a more than adequate kitchen. Our stay was more than comfortable. The staff were always courteous, polite and friendly and a couple of minor maintainance issues were repaired within hours- the oven element and a loose shower head. The locatation is superb, short walk to the bus or train, supermarket across the road and an abundance of multicultural eating places and pubs close by. Darling Harbour is a short stroll away. If you are looking for 5 star accommodation then this probably is not for you, but if you are looking for a great location, friendly staff and low cost then these apartments must be considered. I will be staying there again next year, there is no where else for price, comfort and convenience in the CBD

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sgb26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf in 2004 with my niece and two teenage sons. The location was superb. Easy walking distance to all public transport and the monorail runs along the front of the hotel. The kids used the sauna and pool on the roof everyday. There is a beautiful restaurant and convenience store within yards of the entrance. Our flight landed in the morning, our room was available and the staff were friendly. The furnishings were tired and the carpet needed replacing, but there was everything you needed. Excellent value for a large apartment in the middle of Sydney. I am booked in again this September

Reviews.Title: “its disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Hartlepudlian
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the internet during 2005, and from the internet description it looked really good and more than reasonably priced. The reception area was nothing like the one shown on the net - its tatty to say the very least. We were given a one bedroom apartment on the 18th floor and it was disgusting, filthy stained carpet, hardly any cooking equiment, blankets stained and curtains that had seen better days. Furniture all in poor state, bed springs hardly existant and the two setees were grotty, the view from the windows was onto a building site. We had booked for a week and stayed one night - the receptionist said that the apartments were somewhat passed their best ....... If you have booked an apartment - cancel it now and go to the Metro Apartments on Darling Harbour

Reviews.Title: “The best accomodations and the best price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Waldorf Apartment Hotel in the CBD twice, once in 2001, once in 1999. Both times I was amazed at how clean and comfortable the apartments were, especially considering that they were far less expensive than even the cheapest "proper" hotels in the Sydney area. The first trip, they did not have our one bedroom apartment available, so they gave us a two bedroom instead, for no extra charge. On that trip their rooftop swimming pool was also being renovated and they paid for round trip cabs each day for my daughter and I to go to the recently opened public pool at a nearby park. The staff were always friendly and helpful, the Italian restaurant downstairs was the room service provider and sent up delicious food, and the view from our balcony was great! I wish I still was married to my Aussie so that I had reason and finances to go back. I would stay at the Waldorf Apartments any time!

HotelInfo.Name: Waldorf Apartment Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 57 Liverpool St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
